message: Bob, I'm offering you my product for $850,000. This is a fair price, considering its value to you. I'm confident you'll find it a worthwhile investment. Let me know your thoughts.
I appreciate your confidence in the product's value, but I was thinking more along the lines of $700,000. I believe it's a fair price considering its worth to me.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $700,000 is significantly lower than the value I'm seeking.  I'm willing to compromise, but I can't go below $825,000. This price still allows you a good return on your investment.  Let's find a middle ground.

I appreciate your willingness to compromise, but $825,000 is still a bit out of my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway, so I'll offer $775,000. This is my final offer, and I'm hoping we can come to an agreement.

Bob, I understand your budget constraints, but $775,000 is still below the value I need to achieve. I'm prepared to come down to $800,000, which is the minimum I can accept. This price allows you to secure the product at a fair value, while also meeting my needs. I believe this is a fair compromise.
